content.json: # Microsoft Exchange Security Review

parameters.name: DateOfConfiguration
parameters.label: Collection time
parameters.query:
let _configurationEnv = split(iff(isnull({EnvironmentList}) or isempty({EnvironmentList}) or tolower({EnvironmentList}) == "all","All",tostring({EnvironmentList})),',');
ESIExchangeConfig_CL
| extend ScopedEnvironment = iff(_configurationEnv contains "All", "All",ESIEnvironment_s) 
| where ScopedEnvironment in (_configurationEnv)
| extend Collection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd')
| summarize Collection = max(Collection)
| project Collection = "lastdate", Selected = true
| join kind= fullouter  ( ESIExchangeConfig_CL | extend ScopedEnvironment = iff(_configurationEnv contains "All", "All",ESIEnvironment_s) 
    | where ScopedEnvironment in (_configurationEnv)
    | where TimeGenerated > ago(90d)
    | extend Collection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd')
    | summarize by Collection 
    | join kind= fullouter ( ESIExchangeConfig_CL | extend ScopedEnvironment = iff(_configurationEnv contains "All", "All",ESIEnvironment_s) 
        | where ScopedEnvironment in (_configurationEnv)
        | where TimeGenerated > ago(90d)
        | extend Collection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd')
        | extend PreciseCollection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm ')
        | summarize by PreciseCollection, Collection 
        | join kind=leftouter (
            ESIExchangeConfig_CL | extend ScopedEnvironment = iff(_configurationEnv contains "All", "All",ESIEnvironment_s) 
            | where ScopedEnvironment in (_configurationEnv)
            | where TimeGenerated > ago(90d)
            | extend Collection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd')
            | extend PreciseCollection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm')
            | summarize by PreciseCollection, Collection 
            | summarize count() by Collection
        ) on Collection
    ) on Collection
) on Collection
| project Value = iif(Selected,Collection,iif(count_ > 1,PreciseCollection,Collection1)), Label = iif(Selected,"Last Known date",iif(count_ > 1,PreciseCollection,Collection1)), Selected
| sort by Selected, Value desc

content.json:
This workbook helps review your Exchange Security configuration.
Select your Exchange Organization and adjust the time range.
By default, the Help won't be displayed. To display the help, choose Yes on the toogle buttom "Show Help"

# Workbook goals

The goal of this workbook is to outline key security configurations of your Exchange On-Premises environment.

Most of Exchange organizations have were installed years ago (sometimes more than 10 years). Many configurations have been done and might not have been documented. For most environments, the core commitment was maintaining a high availability of the users‚Äô mailboxes putting aside other consideration (even security considerations). Recommended security practices have also evolved since the first released and a regular review is necessary.

This workbook is designed to show your Exchange organization is configured with a security point of view. Indeed, some configurations easy to display as there are no UI available.

For each configuration, you will find explanations and recommendations when applicable.

- This workbook does not pretend to show you every weak Security configurations, but the most common issues and known to be used by attackers. 
- It will not show you if you have been comprised, but will help you identify unexpected configuration.

----

## Quick reminder of how Exchange works

During Exchange installation two very important groups are created :
- Exchange Trusted Subsystem : Contain all the computer accounts for Exchange Server
- Exchange Windows Permissions : Contain the group Exchange trusted Subsystem

These groups have :
- Very high privileges in ALL AD domains including the root domain
- Right on any Exchange including mailboxes

As each Exchange server computer account is member of Exchange Trusted Subsystem, it means by taking control of the computer account or being System on an Exchange server you will gain access to all the permissions granted to Exchange Trusted Subsystem and Exchange Windows Permissions.

To protect AD and Exchange, it is very important to ensure the following:
- There is a very limited number of persons that are local Administrator on Exchange server
- To protect user right like : Act part of the operating System, Debug

Every service account or application that have high privileges on Exchange need to be considered as sensitive

** üí° Exchange servers need to be considered as very sensitive servers**

-----


## Tabs

### Mailbox Access

This tab will show you several top sensitive delegations that allow an account to access, modify, act as another user, search, export the content of a mailbox.

### Exchange & AD Groups

This tab will show you the members of Exchange groups and Sensitive AD groups.

### Local Administrators

This tab will show you the non standard content of the local Administrators group. Remember that a member of the local Administrators group can take control of the computer account of the server and then it will have all the permissions associated with Exchange Trusted Subsytem and Exchange Windows Permissions

The information is displayed with different views : 
- List of nonstandard users
- Number of servers with a nonstandard a user
- Nonstandard groups content
- For each user important information are displayed like last logon, last password set, enabled

### Exchange Security configuration

This tab will show you some important configuration for your Exchange Organization
- Status of Admin Audit Log configuration
- Status of POP and IMAP configuration : especially, is Plaintext Authentication configured ?
- Nonstandard permissions on the Exchange container in the Configuration Partition

### Transport Configuration

This tab will show you the configuration of the main Transport components
- Receive Connectors configured with Anonymous and/or Open Relay
- Remote Domain Autoforward configuration
- Transport Rules configured with BlindCopyTo, SendTo, RedirectTo
- Journal Rule and Journal Recipient configurations
- Accepted Domains with *

content.title: Security Configuration for the Exchange environment

content.json: This tab displays several security information regarding the organization or server's configuration.

This section display the Exchange version and the CU installed. For the latest build number, check this link : Exchange Build Numbers This section is built from a file located in the public github repository. The repository is manually updated by the team project when new CU/SU are released.

content.query:
let ExchCUSU = externaldata (Productname:string, CU:string, SU:string, BuildNbAll:string, BuilCUNb:string, Major:string, CUBuildNb:string, SUBuildNb:string)[h"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nlepagnez/ESI-PublicContent/main/Operations/Watchlists/ExchBuildNumber.csv"]with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)| project Productname,CU,SU,BuildNbAll,BuilCUNb,Major,CUBuildNb,SUBuildNb;
//ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="ExchangeServers",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
//| extend  VersionNumber = strcat(CmdletResultValue.AdminDisplayVersion.Major,".",CmdletResultValue.AdminDisplayVersion.Minor,".",CmdletResultValue.AdminDisplayVersion.Build)
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="ExchVersion",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| extend  VersionNumber = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ProductVersion)
| extend  Server = tostring(ProcessedByServer_s)
| extend CmdletResultType = tostring(CmdletResultType)
| join kind= leftouter  (ExchCUSU) on $left.VersionNumber == $right.BuildNbAll
| distinct Server,VersionNumber,Productname,CU,SU,CmdletResultType
| extend Server = strcat("üíª ",Server)
| extend Productname = case ( VersionNumber startswith "15.02", "Exchange 2019", VersionNumber startswith "15.01", "Exchange 2016",  VersionNumber startswith "15.00","Exchange 2013", "Exchange 2010")
| extend CU = iff(CmdletResultType <>"Success", "Unable to retrieve information from server", iff(CU <> "", CU, "New CU or SU not yet in the List"))
| extend SU = iff(CmdletResultType <>"Success", "Unable to retrieve information from server", iff( SU <> "", SU, "New CU or SU not yet in the List"))
|project-away CmdletResultType
| sort by Server asc
content.title: Exchange servers CU-SU level

content.query:
let ExchCUSU = externaldata (Productname:string, CU:string, SU:string, BuildNbAll:string, BuilCUNb:string, Major:string, CUBuildNb:string, SUBuildNb:string)[h"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nlepagnez/ESI-PublicContent/main/Operations/Watchlists/ExchBuildNumber.csv"]with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)| project Productname,CU,SU,BuildNbAll,BuilCUNb,Major,CUBuildNb,SUBuildNb;
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="ExchVersion",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
//| extend  VersionNumber = strcat(CmdletResultValue.AdminDisplayVersion.Major,".",CmdletResultValue.AdminDisplayVersion.Minor,".",CmdletResultValue.AdminDisplayVersion.Build)
| extend  VersionNumber = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ProductVersion)
| extend  Server = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Server)
| join kind= leftouter  (ExchCUSU) on $left.VersionNumber == $right.BuildNbAll
| extend CU = iff( CU <> "", CU, "New CU/SU not yet in the CU List")
| extend Version =strcat (VersionNumber,"-",CU,"-",SU)
| summarize dcount(Server) by Version
content.title: Version break down

content.json: The Admin Audit log stores all the actions performed on Exchange Servers (except read actions such as Get/Test). Admin Audit Log Manage Admin Audit Log This can be used to track - Unexpected behaviors - Who did a modification - Real actions performed by an account (the output could be used with to identify the necessary privileges) ‚ÑπÔ∏è Recommendations - Ensure that Admin Audit Log is not disabled - Ensure that critical Cmdlets have not been excluded - Ensure that AdminAuditLogCmdlets is set to * (list of audited Cmdlets) - Review the retention configuration for the Admin Audit Log content
Here the main settings for the Admin Audit Log. Remember that AdminAudit log need to be enabled and no cmdlet should be excluded. Also check the retention limit.

content.query:
let SensitiveCMDLet = externaldata (Cmdlet:string, UserOriented:string, Parameters:string)[h"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nlepagnez/ESI-PublicContent/main/Operations/Watchlists/CmdletWatchlist.csv"]with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)| project Cmdlet,UserOriented,Parameters;
let AAL = (ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="AdminAuditLog",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| extend AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets = CmdletResultValue.AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets
| project AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets);
let SentsitivecmdletTrack = toscalar(SensitiveCMDLet | where Cmdlet has_any ( AAL)| project Cmdlet);
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="AdminAuditLog",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend AdminAuditLogEnabled = iff(CmdletResultValue.AdminAuditLogEnabled == "FALSE", " ‚ùå Disabled, High Risk", "‚úÖ Enabled")
| extend AdminAuditLogAgeLimit = tostring(CmdletResultValue.AdminAuditLogAgeLimit)
| extend AdminAuditLogAgeLimit = substring(AdminAuditLogAgeLimit,8)
| extend AdminAuditLogAgeLimit =substring(AdminAuditLogAgeLimit,0,indexof(AdminAuditLogAgeLimit, ','))
| extend AdminAuditLogAgeLimit = iff(toint(AdminAuditLogAgeLimit) == 0,strcat("‚ùå No AdminAuditlog recorded ",AdminAuditLogAgeLimit), iff(toint(AdminAuditLogAgeLimit) <=30,strcat("‚ö†Ô∏è Value to low except if exported ",AdminAuditLogAgeLimit), strcat("‚úÖ",AdminAuditLogAgeLimit)))
| extend AdminAuditLogCmdlets = tostring(CmdletResultValue.AdminAuditLogCmdlets)
| extend AdminAuditLogCmdlets = substring(AdminAuditLogCmdlets,2)
| extend AdminAuditLogCmdlets = substring(AdminAuditLogCmdlets,0,indexof(AdminAuditLogCmdlets, '"]') )
| extend AdminAuditLogCmdlets = replace_string(AdminAuditLogCmdlets,'"',"")
| extend Comment_AdminAuditLogCmdlets = iff( AdminAuditLogCmdlets == "*","‚úÖ Default configuration","‚ùå if AdminAuditLogCmdlets empty no logging else only AdminAuditLogCmdlets will be logged")
| extend AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets = tostring(CmdletResultValue.AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets)
| extend AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets = substring(AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets,2)
| extend AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets = substring(AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets,0,indexof(AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets, ']'))
| extend AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets = replace_string(AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets,'"',"")
//| extend Cmdlet = replace_string(AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets,'"',"")
//| extend AALECSplit = tostring(split(AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets,","))
| project-away CmdletResultValue
| extend Comment_AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlet = case(  isnotempty( SentsitivecmdletTrack ),"‚ùå Some excluded CmdLets are part of Sensitive Cmdlets",AdminAuditLogExcludedCmdlets <>"","‚ö†Ô∏è Some Cmdlets are excluded ","‚úÖ No Excluded CmdLet")

content.json: ### POP authentication configuration

If the POP Service is started, the LoginType should not set to Plaintext. This means that the password will be sent in clear on the network. As POP is enabled by default on all the mailboxes, this represents a high security risk. POP Authentication - **PlainText** TLS encryption is not required on port 110. Usernames and passwords are sent unencrypted unless the underlying connection is encrypted by using TLS or SSL. - **PlainTextAuthentication** TLS encryption is not required on port 110. However, Basic authentication is permitted only on a port that uses TLS or SSL encryption. - **SecureLogin** Connection on port 110 must use TLS encryption before authenticating. ‚ÑπÔ∏è Recommendations Disable POP on all mailboxes except those who need to actually use this protocol. Set the authentication to SecureLogin or at least to PlainTextAuthentication and configure the application. If the application is not able to perform this type of authentication: - Ensure that POP is disabled on all the mailboxes except those who really need it - Monitor the POP connections - Change the password of the application on a regular basis Recommended Reading : Configuring Authentication for POP3 and IMAP4 Set-PopSettings In order to track mailboxes that are currently using POP - Enable POP logging - Set-PopSettings -Server SRV1 -ProtocolLogEnabled verbose - Several weeks later, analyze the log content - Default location : - Get-PopSettings -server SRV1 | fl server,*log* - Check for connection and authentication

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="PopSettings",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| extend ServerName =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.Server.Name)
| join kind = leftouter(ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="POPIMAPServicesStatus",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| where CmdletResultValue.Name contains ("MSExchangePop3")
| project ServerName= tostring(CmdletResultValue.Server), ServiceName=CmdletResultValue.Name, Status=CmdletResultValue.StatusString,StartupType=CmdletResultValue.StartTypeString
| join (ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="POPIMAPServicesStatus",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| where CmdletResultValue.Name contains ("MSExchangePop3BE" )
| project ServerName= tostring(CmdletResultValue.Server), ServiceName=CmdletResultValue.Name, Status=CmdletResultValue.StatusString,StartupType=CmdletResultValue.StartTypeString) on ServerName) on ServerName
| extend ServerName =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.Server.Name)
| extend LoginType =  iff(CmdletResultValue.LoginType== 1 , "‚õî PlainText, High Risk", iff(CmdletResultValue.LoginType== 2, "‚ö†Ô∏è PlainTextAuthentication","‚úÖ SecureLogin"))
| extend ProtocolLogEnabled =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.ProtocolLogEnabled)
| extend ServiceName =  iff(tostring(ServiceName)=="", "Service Status not retrieved",tostring(ServiceName))
| extend Status =  tostring(Status)
| extend BackendEndService=  tostring(ServiceName1)
| extend StartupType =  tostring(StartupType)
| extend BEStatus =  tostring(Status1)
| extend BEStartupType =  tostring(StartupType1)
| project ServerName,LoginType,ServiceName,Status,StartupType,BackendEndService,BEStatus,BEStartupType,ProtocolLogEnabled
| sort by ServerName asc
content.title: Pop Authentication : should not be set as Plaintext

content.json: ### IMAP authentication configuration

If the IMAP Service is started, the LoginType should not set to Plaintext. This means that the passwords will be sent in clear over the network. As IMAP is enabled by default on all the mailboxes, this is a high security risk. IMAP Authentication - **PlainText** TLS encryption is not required on port 110. User name and password are sent unencrypted unless the underlying connection is encrypted by using TLS or SSL. - **PlainTextAuthentication** TLS encryption is not required on port 143. However, Basic authentication is permitted only on a port that uses TLS or SSL encryption. - **SecureLogin** Connection on port 143 must use TLS encryption before authenticating. ‚ÑπÔ∏è Recommendations Disable IMAP on all mailboxes except those which needs to use this protocol. Set the authentication to SecureLogin or at least to PlainTextAuthentication and configure the application accordingly. If the application is not able to perform this type of authentication: - Ensure that IMAP is disable on all the mailboxes except those who really need it - Monitor the connection - Regularly, change the password of the application Recommended Reading : Configuring Authentication for POP3 and IMAP4 Set-IMAPSettings In order to track mailboxes that are currently using IMAP - Enable IMAP logging - Set-IMAPSettings -Server SRV1 -ProtocolLogEnabled verbose - Several weeks later, analyze the log content - Default location : Get-IMAPSettings -server SRV1 | fl server,*log* - Check for connection and authentication

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="IMAPSettings",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| extend ServerName =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.Server.Name)
| join kind = leftouter(ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="POPIMAPServicesStatus",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| where CmdletResultValue.Name contains ("MSExchangeIMAP4")
| project ServerName= tostring(CmdletResultValue.Server), ServiceName=CmdletResultValue.Name, Status=CmdletResultValue.StatusString,StartupType=CmdletResultValue.StartTypeString
| join (ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="POPIMAPServicesStatus",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| where CmdletResultValue.Name contains ("MSExchangeIMAP4BE" )
| project ServerName= tostring(CmdletResultValue.Server), ServiceName=CmdletResultValue.Name, Status=CmdletResultValue.StatusString,StartupType=CmdletResultValue.StartTypeString) on ServerName) on ServerName
| extend ServerName =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.Server.Name)
| extend LoginType =  iff(CmdletResultValue.LoginType== 1 , "‚õî PlainText, High Risk", iff(CmdletResultValue.LoginType== 2, "‚ö†Ô∏è PlainTextAuthentication","‚úÖ SecureLogin"))
| extend ProtocolLogEnabled =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.ProtocolLogEnabled)
| extend ServiceName =  iff(tostring(ServiceName)=="", "Service Status not retrieved",tostring(ServiceName))
| extend Status =  tostring(Status)
| extend BackendEndService=  tostring(ServiceName1)
| extend StartupType =  tostring(StartupType)
| extend BEStatus =  tostring(Status1)
| extend BEStartupType =  tostring(StartupType1)
| project ServerName,LoginType,ServiceName,Status,StartupType,BackendEndService,BEStatus,BEStartupType,ProtocolLogEnabled
| sort by ServerName asc
content.title: IMAP Authentication  : should not be set as Plaintext

content.json: This section highlights nonstandard permissions on Configuration Partition for Exchange container. By selecting Yes for Generic All buttom only delegation set for Generic All will be display. Standard, Deny and inherited permissions have been removed

During the lifetime of an Exchange Organization, many permissions may have been set on Exchange containers in the Configuration Partition. This section displayed all the nonstandard permissions found on the most important Exchange containers : - Groups from legacy Exchange versions (Exchange Enterprise Servers, Exchange Domain Servers,...) - SID for deleted accounts - Old service accounts (that may not have been disabled or removed...) When an administrator run setup /prepareAD, his account will be granted Generic All at the top-level Exchange container By default, this section only displayed the Generic All permissions. This section is built by removing all the standard AD and Exchange groups. Exchange 2013 deployment permissions reference

content.query:
let StandardGroup = dynamic(["Authenticated Users", "Domain Admins",  "Enterprise Admins","Schema Admins", "Exchange Trusted Subsystem", "Exchange Servers","Organization Management", "Public Folder Management","Delegated Setup", "ANONYMOUS LOGON", "NETWORK SERVICE", "SYSTEM", "Everyone","Managed Availability Servers"]);
let Exchsrv =ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="ExchangeServers",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")| summarize make_list(CmdletResultValue.Name);
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="PartConfPerm",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| project CmdletResultValue
| where CmdletResultValue.Deny !contains "True" and CmdletResultValue.IsInherited !contains "True"
| where (CmdletResultValue.AccessRights == "[983551]") in ({GenericAll})
| where not (CmdletResultValue.UserString has_any (StandardGroup)) in ({NonStandardPermissions})
| where not (CmdletResultValue.UserString has_any (Exchsrv))in ({NonStandardPermissions})
| extend Name =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.Identity.Name)
| extend Account =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.UserString )
| extend AccessRights =  iff (tostring(CmdletResultValue.AccessRightsString) contains "GenericAll", strcat ("‚ùå ",tostring(CmdletResultValue.AccessRightsString)), tostring(CmdletResultValue.AccessRightsString))
| extend ExtendedRights =   iff (tostring(CmdletResultValue.ExtendedRightsString) contains "-As", strcat ("‚ùå ",tostring(CmdletResultValue.ExtendedRightsString)), tostring(CmdletResultValue.ExtendedRightsString))
| extend InheritanceType =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.InheritanceType)
| extend DN = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Identity.DistinguishedName)
| project-away CmdletResultValue
| sort by DN desc

items.name: Security Configuration for the Exchange environment

content.json:
This tab displays important security configurations that allow access to all or partial mailboxes' content - Direct delegations are not listed - Example :
- Permissions Full Access - Permission on mailboxes folders

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRA",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList})
//| where CmdletResultValue.Name !contains "Deleg" and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName != "Hygiene Management" and  CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName != "Exchange Online-ApplicationAccount" and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName != "Discovery Management"
| where CmdletResultValue.Name !contains "Deleg" 
| where CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName !in ("Hygiene Management","Exchange Online-ApplicationAccount","Discovery Management")
| where CmdletResultValue.Role.Name contains "Export" or CmdletResultValue.Role.Name contains "Impersonation" or (CmdletResultValue.Role.Name contains "Search" and CmdletResultValue.Role.Name !contains "MailboxSearchApplication")
| summarize dcount(tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName)) by role=tostring(CmdletResultValue.Role.Name)
content.title: Number of delegations for sensitive RBAC roles

content.json: This delegation allows the delegated account to access and modify the content of every mailboxes using EWS.

**ApplicationImpersonation** is a RBAC role that allows access (read and modify) to the content of all mailboxes using EWS. ‚ö° This role is very powerfull. It should be carefully delegated. When a delegation is necessary, RBAC scopes should be configured to limit the list of impacted mailboxes. Help for the role Application Impersonation It is common (but not recommended) to see service accounts from backup solution, antivirus software, MDM... with this delegation. Note that the default configuration to the group Hygiene Management is excluded. This group is a sensitive group. Remember to monitor the content of this group.

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRA",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList})
| where CmdletResultValue.Role.Name contains "Impersonation" and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName != "Hygiene Management" and CmdletResultValue.Name !contains "Deleg"
//| extend RoleAssigneeName = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName)
| extend RoleAssigneeType = case(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType== "0" or CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType== "2" , "User", CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType== "10","Group","LinkedGroup")
| extend CustomRecipientWriteScope = tostring(CmdletResultValue.CustomRecipientWriteScope.Name)
| extend CustomConfigWriteScope = tostring(CmdletResultValue.CustomConfigWriteScope.Name)
| extend RecipientWriteScope = case(CmdletResultValue.RecipientWriteScope=="0","None",CmdletResultValue.RecipientWriteScope=="2","Organization",CmdletResultValue.RecipientWriteScope=="3","MyGAL", CmdletResultValue.RecipientWriteScope=="4","Self",CmdletResultValue.RecipientWriteScope=="7", "CustomRecipientScope",CmdletResultValue.RecipientWriteScope=="8","MyDistributionGroups","NotApplicable")
| extend ConfigWriteScope = case(CmdletResultValue.ConfigWriteScope=="0","None",CmdletResultValue.ConfigWriteScope=="7","CustomConfigScope",CmdletResultValue.ConfigWriteScope=="10","OrganizationConfig","NotApplicable")
| extend ConfigReadScope = iff(CmdletResultValue.ConfigReadScope == "0" , "None", "OrganizationConfig")
| extend RecipientReadScope = case(CmdletResultValue.RecipientReadScope=="2","Organization",CmdletResultValue.RecipientReadScope=="3","MyGAL",CmdletResultValue.RecipientReadScope=="4","Self","NotApplicable")
| extend ManagementRoleAssignement = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name)
| extend Status= tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)
| extend RoleAssignmentDelegationType = iff(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssignmentDelegationType =="6" , "Delegating", "Regular") 
| extend RoleAssigneeName = iff( RoleAssigneeType == "User", strcat("üßë‚Äçü¶∞ ",tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName)), strcat("üë™ ", tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName)) )
| project RoleAssigneeName, RoleAssigneeType, Status,CustomRecipientWriteScope, CustomConfigWriteScope, RecipientWriteScope, ConfigWriteScope, ConfigReadScope, RecipientReadScope, ManagementRoleAssignement, RoleAssignmentDelegationType, WhenCreated, WhenChanged

content.json:
This delegation allows to export the content all  mailboxes in a scope in PST file.
Excluded from the result as default configuration :
Delegating delegation to Organization Management

**Mailbox Import Export** is a RBAC role that allows an account to export the content of any maibox in a PST. It also allows search in all mailboxes. ‚ö° This role is very powerfull. By default, this role is not delegated to any user or group. The members of the group Organization Management by default do not have this role but are able to delegate it. Help for the role Mailbox Import Export ‚ÑπÔ∏è Recommendations If you temporarily need this delegation, consider the following: - create an empty group with this delegation - monitor the group content and alert when the group modified - add administrators in this group only for a short period of time.

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRA",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| where CmdletResultValue.Role.Name contains "export" and CmdletResultValue.Name !contains "Deleg"
| extend RoleAssigneeType = case(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType== "0" or CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType== "2" , "User", CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType== "10","Group","LinkedGroup")
| extend CustomRecipientWriteScope = tostring(CmdletResultValue.CustomRecipientWriteScope.Name)
| extend CustomConfigWriteScope = tostring(CmdletResultValue.CustomConfigWriteScope.Name)
| extend RecipientWriteScope = case(CmdletResultValue.RecipientWriteScope=="0","None",CmdletResultValue.RecipientWriteScope=="2","Organization",CmdletResultValue.RecipientWriteScope=="3","MyGAL", CmdletResultValue.RecipientWriteScope=="4","Self",CmdletResultValue.RecipientWriteScope=="7", "CustomRecipientScope",CmdletResultValue.RecipientWriteScope=="8","MyDistributionGroups","NotApplicable")
| extend ConfigWriteScope = case(CmdletResultValue.ConfigWriteScope=="0","None",CmdletResultValue.ConfigWriteScope=="7","CustomConfigScope",CmdletResultValue.ConfigWriteScope=="10","OrganizationConfig","NotApplicable")
| extend ConfigReadScope = iff(CmdletResultValue.ConfigReadScope == "0" , "None", "OrganizationConfig")
| extend RecipientReadScope = case(CmdletResultValue.RecipientReadScope=="2","Organization",CmdletResultValue.RecipientReadScope=="3","MyGAL",CmdletResultValue.RecipientReadScope=="4","Self","NotApplicable")
| extend ManagementRoleAssignement = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name)
| extend Status= tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)
| extend RoleAssignmentDelegationType = iff(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssignmentDelegationType =="6" , "Delegating", "Regular")

content.json:
This delegation allows to search inside all or in a scope of mailboxes and export the result in PST.
Excluded from the result as default configuration :
Delegating delegation to Organization Management
Exchange Online-ApplicationAccount
Discovery Management has been excluded

**Mailbox Search** is an RBAC role that allows an account to search in any mailbox and export the results to a PST. ‚ö° This role is very powerful. By default, this role is only delegated to the group Discovery Management. The members of the group Organization Management do not have this role but are able to delegate it. Help for the role Mailbox Search ‚ÑπÔ∏è Recommendations If you temporarily need this delegation, consider the following: - add the administrators in the Discovery Management group - monitor the group content and alert when the group modified - add administrators in this group only for a short period of time

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRA",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| where CmdletResultValue.Role.Name contains "search" and CmdletResultValue.Name !contains "Deleg"
| where CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName != "Exchange Online-ApplicationAccount" and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName != "Discovery Management"
| extend RoleAssigneeType = case(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType== "0" or CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType== "2" , "User", CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType== "10","Group","LinkedGroup")

| extend ConfigWriteScope = case(CmdletResultValue.ConfigWriteScope=="0","None",CmdletResultValue.ConfigWriteScope=="7","CustomConfigScope",CmdletResultValue.ConfigWriteScope=="10","OrganizationConfig","NotApplicable")
| extend ConfigReadScope = iff(CmdletResultValue.ConfigReadScope == "0" , "None", "OrganizationConfig")
| extend RecipientReadScope = case(CmdletResultValue.RecipientReadScope=="2","Organization",CmdletResultValue.RecipientReadScope=="3","MyGAL",CmdletResultValue.RecipientReadScope=="4","Self","NotApplicable")
| extend ManagementRoleAssignement = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name)
| extend Status= tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)
| extend RoleAssignmentDelegationType = iff(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssignmentDelegationType =="6" , "Delegating", "Regular") 
| extend RoleAssigneeName = iff( RoleAssigneeType == "User", strcat("üßë‚Äçü¶∞ ",tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName)), strcat("üë™ ", tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName)) )
| project RoleAssigneeName, RoleAssigneeType, Status,CustomRecipientWriteScope, CustomConfigWriteScope, RecipientWriteScope, ConfigWriteScope, ConfigReadScope, RecipientReadScope, ManagementRoleAssignement, RoleAssignmentDelegationType, WhenCreated, WhenChanged

content.json: These are delegations at the database level. **Receive As Extended Right on database's objects in the Configuration** When an account has **ReceiveAs** permissions on a database's object, it can open and view the content of any mailboxes on that database. Help for Receive As Permission ‚ÑπÔ∏è Recommendations Do not set this permission on databases. When an application requires this permission, ensure that the application account‚Äôs password is well protected and known by a very limited number of person.Change the password as often as possible. **Send As Extended Right on database objects in the Configuration** When an account has **SendAs** permissions on a database's object, it can send messages from all the mailboxes contained in this database. The messages that are sent from a mailbox will appear as if the mailbox owner sent them. Help for Send As Permission ‚ÑπÔ∏è Recommendations Do not set this permission on databases. When an application requires this permission, ensure that the application account‚Äôs password is well protected and known by a very limited number of person.Change the password as often as possible.

content.json:
The following section will display the content of the local Administrators group for each server

** When content refer to groups from other forests, none or partial information will be displayed and the number of Administrators may be inconsistent. **

Most of the sections display the same information  but with differents sorting, displays...

Only Exchange administrators should be members of the local Administrators group of Exchange servers.

You need to review  the content of the local Administrators group on a regular basis.

It is considered a high security risk to have a discrepancy of members between the servers. 

It is not recommended to have more than one local administrator accounts. Furthermore, the password should be unique on each server and regularly changed. A solution like LAPS could be used to manage the local administrator password.

Only Exchange administrators should be able to logon on Exchange servers.

Here the default content of the local Administrators group for an Exchange server 
:
- Administrator (this account can be renamed)
- Domain Admins
- Exchange Trusted Subsystem
- Organization Management

**Service accounts should not be members of the local Administrators group**. If it is necessary, you need to ensure that the account is dedicated to Exchange. If the service account opens sessions on other servers, it can be used for lateral movements.
**Top 10 servers with high number of unique local Administrators members**

content.query:
let StandardGroup = dynamic(["Administrator", "Domain Admins","Exchange Trusted Subsystem","Organization Management", "Admins du domaine"]);
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="LocalAminGroup",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| where CmdletResultValue.Level != 0
| where not (CmdletResultValue.MemberPath has_any (StandardGroup)) in ({Limited})
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend Parentgroup = trim_end(@'\\Local Administrators',tostring(CmdletResultValue.Parentgroup))
| extend MemberPath = tostring(CmdletResultValue.MemberPath)
| extend ObjectClass = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ObjectClass)
| where ObjectClass !contains "group"
| summarize dcount(MemberPath) by Parentgroup
| top 10 by dcount_MemberPath
| sort by dcount_MemberPath

content.json: This tab displays the content of high privilege groups in Exchange and AD.

The **Exchange Trusted Subsystem** group is one the two most sensistive groups in Exchange. This group has all privileges in Exchange and very high privileges in AD. Exchange 2013 deployment permissions reference This group should only contains computer accounts for each Exchange servers. When the DAG has an IP and a CNO, it is acceptable to have the DAG's computer account. This section only shows direct nonstandard members.

The **Exchange Windows Permissions** group is one the two most sensistive groups in Exchange. This group has very high privileges in AD. Exchange 2013 deployment permissions reference This group should only contains the group Exchange Trusted SubSystem. This section only shows direct nonstandard members.

let OldVGroupEES = (ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="ADGroup", SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}", SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList}, Target = "On-Premises")

    | extend Level = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Level)
    | extend ObjectClass = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ObjectClass)
    | extend Enabled = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled) );
let OldVGroupEDS = (ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="ADGroup", SpecificConfigurationDate="lastdate", SpecificConfigurationEnv='B13', Target = "On-Premises")
    | where CmdletResultValue.Parentgroup == "Exchange Enterprise Servers" and CmdletResultValue.Level ==0
    | extend Parentgroup = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Parentgroup)
| mv-expand CmdletResultValue.Members
| where CmdletResultValue_Members.objectClass == "group"
| project Parentgroup, MemberPath= strcat(Parentgroup,"\\", CmdletResultValue_Members.name), Level = tostring(1), ObjectClass = tostring(CmdletResultValue_Members.objectClass), DN = tostring(CmdletResultValue_Members.DistinguishedName), ObjectGuid = tostring(CmdletResultValue_Members.ObjectGuid)| join kind=inner ( ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="ADGroup", SpecificConfigurationDate="lastdate", SpecificConfigurationEnv='B13', Target = "On-Premises")
    | where CmdletResultValue.Parentgroup == "Exchange Enterprise Servers"
    | extend Parentgroup = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Parentgroup)
    | extend ObjectGuid = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ObjectGuid)) on ObjectGuid) ;
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="ExGroup", SpecificConfigurationDate="lastdate", SpecificConfigurationEnv='B13', Target = "On-Premises") 
| extend Parentgroup = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Parentgroup)
| where CmdletResultValue.Parentgroup in ("Exchange Organization Administrators", "Exchange Recipient Administrators", "Exchange Public Folder Administrators", "Exchange Server Administrator", "Exchange View-Only Administrator")

| extend ObjectClass = tostring(CmdletResultValue.ObjectClass)
| extend Enabled = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)
| extend DN = tostring(CmdletResultValue.DN)
| union OldVGroupEES,OldVGroupEDS
| search CmdletResultValue.Parentgroup == "{Group}"
| where todatetime (CmdletResultValue.LastPwdSetString) < ago(0d) or tostring (CmdletResultValue.LastPwdSetString) == ""
| where todatetime (CmdletResultValue.LastLogonString) < ago(0d) or tostring (CmdletResultValue.LastLogonString) == ""
| sort by tostring(CmdletResultValue.MemberPath) asc 
| where CmdletResultValue.Level != 0
//| extend DN = tostring(CmdletResultValue.DN)

| extend LastPwdSet = CmdletResultValue.LastPwdSetString
| extend LastPwdSet = iif(ObjectClass == "group" or ObjectClass == "computer" or ObjectClass == "Local User" or ObjectClass == "computer", "N/A", iif (todatetime (CmdletResultValue.LastPwdSetString) > ago(366d), CmdletResultValue.LastPwdSetString, iff (LastPwdSet == "", "‚ùå Password never set", strcat("‚ùå", LastPwdSet))))
| extend MemberPath = case(ObjectClass == "group", strcat("üë™ ", MemberPath), ObjectClass == "computer", strcat("üíª ", MemberPath), strcat("üßë‚Äçü¶∞ ", MemberPath))
| project Parentgroup, MemberPath, Level, ObjectClass,LastLogon, LastPwdSet ,Enabled,DN

content.json: ‚ÑπÔ∏è Recommendations - Ensure that no service account are a member of the high privilege groups. Use RBAC to delegate the exact required permissions. - Limit the usage of nested group for administration. - Ensure that accounts are given only the required pernissions to execute their tasks. - Use just in time administration principle by adding users in a group only when they need the permissions, then remove them when their operation is over. - Limit the number of Organization management members. When you review the Admin Audit logs you might see that the administrators rarely needed Organization Management privileges. - Monitor the content of the following groups: - Organization Management - Recipient Management (Member of this group have at least the following rights : set-mailbox, Add-MailboxPermission) - Discovery Management - Server Management - Hygiene Management - Exchange Servers - Exchange Trusted Subsystem - Exchange Windows Permissions - xxx High privilege group (not an exhaustive list) - All RBAC groups that have high roles delegation - All nested groups in high privileges groups - Note that this is not a complete list. The content of all the groups that have high privileges should be monitored. - Each time a new RBAC group is created, decide if the content of this groups should be monitored - Periodically review the members of the groups Help for Built-in role groups

content.title: Open Relay using with Externally Secure
Receive Connectors OpenRelay using Extended Right "ms-Exch-SMTP-Accept-Any-Recipient" for Anonymous

content.json: This view shows all **Receive Connectors** configured configured as Open Relay with the Extended Rights "ms-Exch-SMTP-Accept-Any-Recipient" set on the Receive Connector object in the Configuration partition. Remember that with this configuration, the Exchange servers can be used to send emails outside the organization. Depending on the configuration, the connectors may be protected by IPs. However, IP protection is not safe configuration. You can check if the "ms-Exch-SMTP-Accept-Any-Recipient" ExtendedRights has been added on the Receive connector for Anonymous with PowerShell: `Get-ReceiveConnector | Get-ADPermission | ? {$_.ExtendedRights -like "ms-Exch-SMTP-Accept-Any-Recipient"}` Allow anonymous relay on Exchange server See the section "Receive Connectors with Anonymous Permission" for additional information regarding Anonymous authentication and IP protection.

parameters.name: Server
parameters.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="ExchangeServers",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| project CmdletResultValue
| where CmdletResultValue.ServerRole <> "64"
| extend SRVName = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name)
| distinct SRVName
| sort by SRVName asc

content.json:
The toogle buttom help you to sort by:

- Server
- Receive connectors with no IP restrictions

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="RCAnonymous",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| project Identity,CmdletResultValue
| extend Identity = tostring(Identity)
| extend Server = replace_string(replace_string(tostring(split(CmdletResultValue.DistinguishedName,",",3)),"[\"CN=",""),"\"]","")
|join kind=leftouter  ( ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="ReceiveConnector",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises") ) on $left.Identity == $right.Name
| where CmdletResultValue1.Server.Name contains "{Server}"
| where (CmdletResultValue1.RemoteIPRanges contains "0.0.0.0" or CmdletResultValue1.RemoteIPRanges contains "ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff") in ({NoIPRestriction})
| where CmdletResultValue1.PermissionGroupsString contains "Anonymous" //> 12 and CmdletResultValue.PermissionGroups != 14 and CmdletResultValue.PermissionGroups != 16
| extend Server = tostring(CmdletResultValue1.Server.Name)
| extend Name = tostring(CmdletResultValue1.Name)
| extend TransportRole = iff(CmdletResultValue1.TransportRole== "32" , "HubTransport", "FrontendTransport")
| extend Enabled = tostring(CmdletResultValue1.Enabled)
| extend PermissionGroups = tostring(CmdletResultValue1.PermissionGroupsString) 
| extend AuthMechanism = tostring(CmdletResultValue1.AuthMechanismString)
| mv-expand RemoteIPall=CmdletResultValue1.RemoteIPRanges
| mv-expand BindingAllall=CmdletResultValue1.Bindings
| extend RemoteIP= RemoteIPall.Expression
| extend IP= strcat (BindingAllall.Address,"-",BindingAllall.Port)
| summarize Bindings = make_set(tostring(IP)),RemoteIPRange = make_set(tostring(RemoteIP)) by Server,Name,TransportRole,Enabled,PermissionGroups,AuthMechanism
| sort  by Server asc

content.title: Receive Connectors configure with Externally Secured Authentication

content.json:
This view shows all Receive Connectors configured with Anonymous authentication. It is not recommended to configure connectors with Anonymous authentication.

When configured with Anonymous and No Ip Restriction, any machine can initiate an SMTP session with the Receive Connectors. This can then be used send emails (SPAM/Virus/Phishing....) to all the mailboxes in the organization. The mail will be seen as an internal mail and might bypass some protections.

If you absolute need this configuration because some of your application does not support Authentication, it is strongly recommended to limit the IP addresses that can establish SMTP sessions with Exchange. Do not use range of subnet.

This section has an option button to display 
     All Receive Connectors with Anonymous (No)
     All Receive Connectors with Anonymous and with no IP Restriction (Yes)

content.title: Transport Rules with specific actions to monitor

content.json: A common way used by attackers to exfiltrate data is to set Transport Rules that send all or sensitive messages outside the organization or to a mailbox where they already have full control. This section shows your Transport rules with sentitive actions that can lead to data leaks: - BlindCopyTo - RedirectMessageTo - CopyTo For more information : Mail flow rules in Exchange Serve

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="TransportRule",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend Identity = iif( CmdletResultValue.Identity contains "OrgHierarchyToIgnore",tostring(CmdletResultValue.Identity.Name),tostring(CmdletResultValue.Identity))
//| extend State = tostring(CmdletResultValue.State)
| extend Status= iff ( tostring(CmdletResultValue.State)== "Enabled" or tostring(CmdletResultValue.State)== "1" , "Enabled",iff(tostring(CmdletResultValue.State)=="","", "Disabled"))
| extend SentTo = tostring(CmdletResultValue.SentToString)
| extend BlindCopyTo = tostring(CmdletResultValue.BlindCopyToString)
| extend CopyTo = tostring(CmdletResultValue.CopyToString)
| extend RedirectMessageTo = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RedirectMessageToString)
| extend Mode = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Identity.Mode)
| project-away CmdletResultValue
| sort  by Identity asc
| sort  by Status desc

content.json: ### Journal Mailboxes

The **Journal Mailboxes** contain emails sent and received by specific or all users. The content of these mailboxes is very sensitives. Journal Rules should be reviewed to check if they are still needed. Mailbox audit should be set on these mailboxes. Also by default, no one should access to these mailboxes. Then, it is recommended to regularly check who have Full Access mailbox or Receive As on these mailboxes. Additional information : Journaling in Exchange Server Journaling procedures Mailbox audit logging in Exchange Server

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="JournalRule",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend Identity = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Identity)
| extend Status= iff ( tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)== "Enabled" or tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)== "1" , "Enabled", iff(tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)=="","", "Disabled"))
//| extend Enabled = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)
| extend JournalEmailAddress = tostring(CmdletResultValue.JournalEmailAddress)
| extend Recipient = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Recipient)
| sort  by Identity asc
| sort  by Status desc
| project-away CmdletResultValue
content.title: Journal Rules configured in your environment
Journal Recipients on mailbox databases configured in your environment

content.json: As Journal Recipient on databases send all the mail send to users in this database to a specific mailbox. The content of these mailboxes is very sensitive. Journal Recipients configuration should be reviewed to check if they are still needed. Mailbox audit should be set on these mailboxes. No one should have access to these mailboxes by default. It is recommended to regularly check who have Full Access or Receive As on these mailboxes. Additional information : Journaling in Exchange Server Journaling procedures Mailbox audit logging in Exchange Server

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MbxDBJournaling",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| where CmdletResultValue.JournalRecipient !=""
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend Identity = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Identity.Name)
| extend Enabled = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)
| extend JournalRecipient = tostring(CmdletResultValue.JournalRecipient)
| project-away CmdletResultValue
| sort  by Identity asc

content.title: Remote Domain Autofoward Configuration - * should not allow AutoForwardEnabled

content.json: If **AutoForwardEnabled** is set to True for an SMTP domain, then users in Outlook are allowed to set automatic transfer of all their emails to addresses in this domain. When the Default Remote domain is set to * and has the AutoForwardEnabled set True, any user can configure an Outlook rule to automatically forward all emails to any SMTP domain domains outside the organization. This is a high risk configuration as it might allow accounts to leak information. Also, when setting AutoForwardEnabled to a specific domain, it is strongly recommended enable TLS encryption. Additional information: Remote Domains

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="RemoteDomain",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend Name =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name)
| extend Address =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.DomainName.Address)
| extend AutoForwardEnabled =  iff (CmdletResultValue.AutoForwardEnabled== "true" and CmdletResultValue.Address == "*", strcat ("‚ùå",tostring(CmdletResultValue.AutoForwardEnabled)),iff(CmdletResultValue.AutoForwardEnabled== "true" and CmdletResultValue.Address != "*", strcat ("‚ö†Ô∏è",tostring(CmdletResultValue.AutoForwardEnabled)),strcat ("‚úÖ",tostring(CmdletResultValue.AutoForwardEnabled))))
| project-away CmdletResultValue
| sort  by Address asc

content.json: Accepted domains set to * authorize Open Relay. More information: Accepted domains

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="AcceptedDomain",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "On-Premises")
| project CmdletResultValue
| where CmdletResultValue.DomainName.Address == "*"
| extend Name =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name)
| extend Address =  tostring(CmdletResultValue.DomainName.Address)
| extend Address =  "* : ‚ùå OpenRelay configuration"
| extend DomainType =  case(CmdletResultValue.DomainType=="0","Authoritative Domain",CmdletResultValue.DomainType=="1","ExternalRelay",CmdletResultValue.DomainType=="2","InternalRelay","NotApplicable")
| project-away CmdletResultValue
